byline.contributor: Matt Flegenheimer and Michael M. Grynbaum contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By SUSANNE CRAIG and THOMAS KAPLAN

abstract: New York State lawmakers fail to reach agreement on number of big-ticket issues, including how much rent landlords can charge for apartments in New York City and its suburbs.
lead_paragraph: Rent regulations limiting how much landlords can charge for about one million apartments in New York City and its suburbs expired after lawmakers failed to reach an agreement on how to extend them.

headline.main: New York Rent Regulation Laws Expire Amid Last-Minute Talks
headline.print_headline: Rent Regulation Laws Expire Amid Last-Minute Talks

snippet: Rent regulations limiting how much landlords can charge for about one million apartments in New York City and its suburbs expired after lawmakers failed to reach an agreement on how to extend them.
